title: fun with words
content:
Inspired by Alan Fletcher’s _The Art of Looking Sideways_,  
I decided to put up my random little typographic thoughts  
into a visual journal. Please let me know what you think.  
 [http://www.salsen.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906163323/http:/www.salsen.com/)  
Also, I recently decided to combine my love of type with  
optical illusions to create some interesting effects, so  
expect more of that in the future!

 [‹ Must Read: The New Yorker](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906163323/http:/www.typophile.com/node/16544 "Go to previous forum topic") [Comprehensive Historical Type Directory? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906163323/http:/www.typophile.com/node/16536 "Go to next forum topic")
author: koleslaw

comments.content: Those are neat! I chuckled at the a-hole/counter joke. :o)

I like your Stereogram best, but I cannot see it, if you help me I appreciate.  
Link “visual arts” from [http://www.tornquist.it](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906163323/http:/www.tornquist.it/ "http://www.tornquist.it") , J.T. was my prof. for Color Design, I am sure you can get some inspiration for your art.

Regards,  
AS

Interesting stuff there

And in your portfolio too! I like the Itte Restaurant pieces very much :-)

AS, I’m surprised you liked the stereogram best considering the fact that you can’t see it. I put the black X marks there to indicate the amount of unfocusing you should attempt- merge the two Xs into one, and it’ll work. Thanks for the comments.

Thank you, yes, I can see it now. I cannot see many things dear friend.  
It is actually a big pleasure to read the beauty throught different angles,  
and since beauty is a language, luckily it is not only written.  
I tried to overlap the two parts but the position of the X marks is not precise.

Regards,  
AS
